intro: Alophia graniticola, commonly known as the granitic lily, is a flowering plant native to the rocky habitats of South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale pink blooms during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
